intro: Hibbertia stricta var. pedunculata, commonly known as the narrow-leaved hibbertia, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the Dilleniaceae family and is characterized by its slender, erect stems and narrow, waxy leaves. The plant produces showy, yellow-orange flowers with distinctive red sepals, typically blooming in spring. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in coastal heathlands and open forests. Hibbertia stricta var. pedunculata is valued for its ornamental appeal and is sometimes cultivated in gardens.
